#labels Phase-Implementation
=User Interface Translation=
This page holds all the words and phrases which need translation in order to create a new UI. Only the word or phrase after the semicolon on each line needs to be translated. The text between brackets to the left on each line is a coded description of where the following phrase appears in the program. About half of the phrases on this page are already translated for you if there is a Firefox translation in your language- which there likely is (see [Locale_Creation]).

NOTES:
  * Special symbols like "%1$S", "%2$S", "%3$S" etc. are place holders for numbers which are supplied when the program is actually run. The symbols can be moved or re-ordered, but the symbols themselves should not be changed.
  * Certain entries may contain HTML tags, like "`<b>`" and "`</b>`". These add formatting to the text. But most entries cannot contain HTML.

`[search-help-window.title]:`<b>` Search Help`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.ampersand_description]:`<b>` Finds verses with both "love" <b>and</b> "God"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.ampersand_example]:`<b>` love && God`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.case_sensitivity_note]:`<b>` Note: All searches are case insensitive.`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.description_heading]:`<b>` DESCRIPTION`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.description_of_search_types]:`<b>` <span style="font-size:large;">There are four types of searches to choose from after you click the "More" button:</span><br><br>1) <b>Find verses which contain the word(s)</b>: Finds verses that have all of the given words in the verse.<br><br>2) <b>Find verses which contain this exact text</b>: Finds the exact word, part of a word, or phrase, everywhere that it occurs.<br><br>3) <b>Advanced matching using special search terms</b>: You may use the special search terms listed in the table below to build complex searches:<br><br>4) <b>Find verses which contain similar words</b>: Finds verses that contain words similar to those given. This is useful if you don't know exactly how a word is spelled, or to find variations of words. Results can be listed in order of relevance by unchecking "Show results in order".`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.example_heading]:`<b>` EXAMPLE`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.exclamation_description]:`<b>` Finds verses with "love" but <b>not</b> "God"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.exclamation_example]:`<b>` love !God`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.notes_heading]:`<b>` NOTES`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.parenthesis_description]:`<b>` Finds verses with "great" <b>or</b> "little" <b>and</b> "love"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.parenthesis_example]:`<b>` (great || little) && love`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.question_mark_description]:`<b>` Matches "beloved", "unloved" etc.`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.question_mark_example]:`<b>` ??loved`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.question_mark_notes]:`<b>` Can be used anywhere in word`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.quotes_description]:`<b>` Finds verses with the exact phrase "For God so loved"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.quotes_example]:`<b>` "For God so loved"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.star_description]:`<b>` Matches any word beginning with "Heav"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.star_example]:`<b>` Heav*`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.star_notes]:`<b>` Can be used anywhere except at the beginning of a word`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.term_heading]:`<b>` TERM`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.tilde_description]:`<b>` Finds words <b>spelled similarly</b> to "Nebacadnezzer"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.tilde_example]:`<b>` Nebacadnezzer~`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.tilde_notes]:`<b>` This is useful if you don't know exact spelling of a word`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.vertical_bar_description]:`<b>` Finds verses with either "love" <b>or</b> "God"`</b><br>
`[search-help-window.vertical_bar_example]:`<b>` love || God`</b><br>
